dialogue_turns.speaker: Listener message
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, just wanted to say I'm so excited for the new direct flights to Jordan—finally, a nonstop way to explore Petra!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, just wanted to say I'm so excited for the new direct flights to Jordan-finally, a nonstop way to explore Petra!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstanis will soon be able to travel directly to Jordan, as plans for a new international route are underway.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a great message. Yeah, Royal Jordanian Airlines is planning to start those flights in June 2026.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a great message. Yeah, Royal Jordanian Airlines is planning to start those flights in June twenty twenty six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ambassador Al-Omari announced that Royal Jordanian Airlines plans to begin direct flights to Kazakhstan in June 2026, with a frequency of two flights per week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Two flights a week, right? That's what Ambassador Hamzeh Al-Omari announced.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two flights a week, right? That's what Ambassador Hamzeh Al-Omari announced.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ambassador Al-Omari announced that Royal Jordanian Airlines plans to begin direct flights to Kazakhstan in June 2026, with a frequency of two flights per week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it all came out of that meeting with Kazakhstan's Deputy Minister of Transport, Talgat Lastayev.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it all came out of that meeting with Kazakhstan's Deputy Minister of Transport, Talgat Lastayev.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Deputy Minister of Transport of Kazakhstan, Talgat Lastayev, met with the Ambassador of Jordan to Kazakhstan, Hamzeh Al-Omari, to discuss the launch of direct flights between the two countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting how these diplomatic visits really push things forward. President Tokayev's trip to Jordan back in February 2025 seems to have sparked this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting how these diplomatic visits really push things forward. President Tokayev's trip to Jordan back in February twenty twenty five seems to have sparked this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The initiative follows the visit of Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev to Jordan in February 2025, during which the Jordanian side expressed interest in establishing direct air service with Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And the air services agreement is already being drafted, which is a big step.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And the air services agreement is already being drafted, which is a big step.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, both sides reviewed preparations and the drafting of an air services agreement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The Kazakh side said they're ready to assist too, under existing agreements. So it sounds like everything's moving smoothly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Kazakh side said they're ready to assist too, under existing agreements. So it sounds like everything's moving smoothly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In response, the Kazakh side expressed readiness to assist with the launch of the route under existing agreements.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's not just Jordan though—Kazakhstan's expanding routes everywhere. Did you see the list for May 2025?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not just Jordan though-Kazakhstan's expanding routes everywhere. Did you see the list for May twenty twenty five?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, Kazakhstan's Ministry of Transport announced the launch of new direct flights to several other countries starting in May 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, Hungary, Germany, Turkey… even Vietnam and South Korea. That's huge for connectivity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, Hungary, Germany, Turkey... even Vietnam and South Korea. That's huge for connectivity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These include Hungary, Germany, Turkey, Georgia, Azerbaijan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, China, South Korea, and Vietnam.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. But you know, having a direct flight to Jordan specifically is a game-changer for tourism and business ties.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. But you know, having a direct flight to Jordan specifically is a game-changer for tourism and business ties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No more layovers in, like, Dubai or Istanbul. Just straight to Amman.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No more layovers in, like, Dubai or Istanbul. Just straight to Amman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Summer 2026 can't come soon enough for some travelers, I bet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Summer twenty twenty six can't come soon enough for some travelers, I bet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, Kazakhstanis are expected to be able to fly to Jordan starting from summer 2026.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's exciting to see Central Asia opening up even more to the world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's exciting to see Central Asia opening up even more to the world.
